page.title: 07Colwall 50 Years Ago & Today
page.content: In the thirties Colwall was a tightly knit, insular rural community with its interests and activities agiculturally based. An almost self-supporting place the shops were good, services and repairs of all kinds were immediately available. In 1985 the pattern is quite different. Apart from becoming a dormitory for Worcester and Malvern there has been a great influx of 'outsiders' who have settled here for their retirement. Two major changes occured,both concern traffic. The busy double-tracked railway line has been replaced with a single one carrying little freight and few passengers. The pretty station with its colourful flower beds is now a drab halt with a tiny tin hut. Road transport has grown alarmingly. Through traffic is noisier and much faster while parked vehicles have transformed the peaceful village.
